การพยากรณ์ราคา XRP สำหรับวันที่ 6 กุมภาพันธ์

XRP Price Prediction For February 6

1d ago//﻿Anjali Belgaumkar
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

ราคา XRP ปรับตัวลดลงต่อเนื่องโดยร่วงประมาณ 12% หลังจากแตกต่ำกว่าช่วงการรวบรวมตัวของราคา ซึ่งสะท้อนให้เห็นถึงแรงขายที่แข็งแกร่งในตลาดคริปโตโดยรวม การวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิคชี้ว่าราคาอาจพบแนวรับและทรงตัวในช่วงระหว่าง $1.36 และ $1.21 โดยระดับ $1.21 ถูกมองว่าเป็นจุดสำคัญที่แรงซื้ออาจกลับเข้ามา เพื่อให้เกิดแนวโน้มการฟื้นตัวที่ชัดเจน XRP จำเป็นต้องยกตัวขึ้นกลับไปเหนือระดับ $1.64 เพื่อลดทอนแรงกดดันขายลง ปัจจุบัน การเคลื่อนไหวของ XRP ยังคงเชื่อมโยงอย่างใกล้ชิดกับสภาพตลาดในฝั่งสินทรัพย์ดิจิทัลโดยรวม โดยเคลื่อนไหวไปในทิศทางเดียวกับการร่วงลงของ Bitcoin และ Ethereum

EN

XRP has extended its losses, dropping approximately 12% after breaking below a triangular consolidation pattern, signaling a corrective phase influenced by broader market weakness. Technical projections indicate that the price may find stabilization between $1.36 and $1.21, with the $1.21 level representing a critical 50% retracement of the previous rally where buying demand could emerge. For a sustained recovery, XRP needs to reclaim the $1.64 level to confirm that downward momentum is easing. Currently, the asset's performance remains closely linked to the wider digital asset market, tracking losses seen in Bitcoin and Ethereum, suggesting that volatility will persist until overall market sentiment improves.

Key Points

  • XRP dropped 12% after breaking below a triangular consolidation pattern.
  • Key support levels to watch are $1.36, $1.29, and $1.21.
  • A move above $1.64 is required to trigger a sustained recovery.
  • XRP's trend is dependent on broader market conditions affecting Bitcoin and Ethereum.

Article

The price of XRP continued to move lower this week, extending its corrective phase after breaking below a consolidation pattern and reflecting broader weakness across the cryptocurrency market. XRP has fallen about 12% in a short period, with chart-based projections placing the next important price region between $1.36 and $1.21, where the decline could begin to slow if buying demand strengthens. Decline follows break below consolidation range The latest downward move accelerated after XRP dropped below a triangular consolidation pattern that had held prices steady for several sessions. Once the lower boundary of that range was breached, selling intensified and prices moved rapidly toward lower technical projections. Analysts describe the current move as part of a broader corrective cycle within the longer-term trend, in which a rapid final phase of selling typically follows the completion of earlier consolidation waves. Retracement levels define the next trading range Technical projections based on earlier price swings place potential stabilization zones near $1.36, $1.29, and $1.21. The $1.21 area corresponds roughly to a 50% retracement of the previous upward rally, a region where declines often begin to slow as longer-term investors re-enter the market. If prices fall below that band, the correction could extend toward lower historical trading ranges, with some analysts pointing to significantly lower retracement zones as alternative scenarios depending on overall crypto market sentiment. Recovery requires reclaiming earlier range For a sustained recovery to develop, XRP would need to move back above approximately $1.64, which marked the upper boundary of the earlier consolidation zone. A move above that level would indicate that downward momentum is easing and that a more stable price base is forming. Broader market conditions remain the main driver The current XRP decline has taken place alongside a wider digital-asset downturn, in which Bitcoin, Ethereum and other major cryptocurrencies have also experienced steep losses. Analysts say XRP’s direction in the near term is likely to remain closely linked to the broader crypto market environment, including institutional flows, leverage reductions and overall investor sentiment. Until a clear reversal develops, XRP is expected to remain within a corrective phase characterized by sharp short-term fluctuations and gradual attempts to stabilize near major retracement regions.
